## Hitler-Stalin

{{< var todo >}}

The collaboration extended to the harmonization of nationalistic to chauvinistic cultural and media channels, from which the word “fascism” disappeared. Sergei Eisenstein staged Wagner at the Bolshoi Theater, the libraries of the USSR were purged, anti-fascist works by Thomas and Heinrich Mann or Franz Werfel (and even those by communist authors such as Willi Bredel, Hans Marchwitza, and Erich Weinert) disappeared, as did the émigré newspapers.[^germany-russia-1]
